snippet: Texas high school sports officials showed leniency Thursday after a former assistant football coach denied ordering two players to blindside a referee but acknowledged making comments that might have unintentionally instigated the hit.
abstract: Mack Breed, former assistant football coach at  John Jay High School in San Antonio, Tex, is suspended for remainder of school year and given two-year probation for allegedly telling players to hit referee Robert Watts during game.
lead_paragraph: Texas high school sports officials showed leniency Thursday after a former assistant football coach denied ordering two players to blindside a referee but acknowledged making comments that might have unintentionally instigated the hit.
